column1: The '''Shirebourn''' is a lesser river of [[the Shire]]'s [[Eastfarthing]]. Its source was in the uplands of the [[Green Hill Country]]
column2: from where it flowed south and then southeast
column3: where it matched the boundary with the [[Southfarthing]]. At [[Willowbottom]]

column1: The Shirebourn flowed into the Brandywine beneath [[Deephallow]]
column2: and at its mouth formed the boggy region known as the [[Overbourn Marshes]]
column3: opposite the [[Haysend|southern end]] of the [[High Hay]].<ref>{{FR|Part}}</ref> Its outflow was the [[Mithe]].<ref>{{ATB|2}}</ref>
it is translated "River of the Shire" instead.<ref>[[Wayne G. Hammond]]
